thread.title: City plan would dramatically expand Austin Convention Center
thread.title_full: City plan would dramatically expand Austin Convention Center

author: Michael Theis
title: City plan would dramatically expand Austin Convention Center
text:
Nick Simonite/ABJ SXSW attendees walk through the Austin Convention Center in March 2015. A city plan could expand the Austin Convention Center by four city blocks by 2021 and cost between $400 million and $600 million, reports the Austin American Statesman . The price tag, however, does not include costs to buy the land needed for the expansion, according to the report. The plan, part of a 2014 report presented to the city's Economic Opportunity Commission Monday, would include a high-rise hotel and a large expansion of the convention center space itself, reports the Austin Monitor. It would include expanded parking underground, and would transform adjacent Trinity Street into a pedestrian thoroughfare.
